name: Granulator
description:
This algorithm is an implementation of the original Granulator algorithm on the disting EX. It implements a granular synthesis engine, taking as its source material either live audio input or audio loaded from the MicroSD card. Live audio can be recorded into a buffer or streamed continuously.

Granular synthesis works by playing many short snippets of sound, or 'grains', typically of the order of 100ms in length. Often various properties of the grains (e.g., their timing, length, pitch, stereo panning) are randomized to some extent.

In this algorithm, the creation ('spawning') of grains is controlled by 'notes'. Notes control when grain clouds begin and end, and affect other features such as grain pitch. Notes can be played via CV/gate pairs, MIDI, or I2C. The algorithm also offers three 'drone' voices that can simply be enabled via the parameter interface.

The display shows a waveform representation of the audio buffer with dots indicating currently playing grains. Two dotted lines represent the 'Size mean' (by separation) and 'Delay mean' (by position within the buffer). On the right, it shows current buffer size, delay, and number of grains playing.
use_cases: Real-time sound design using CV/MIDI/I2C control
Audio effects with feedback and drones
